definition: sound of crying
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"

sentences.english: The pig squealed, curled up its tail tightly and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 那頭豬哇哇地叫着，縮緊它的尾巴逃走了。

sentences.english: Finally , I sit on the ground of nasty cry loudly.
sentences.chinese: 最後急的我，坐在地上哇哇大哭。

sentences.english: Plus, he wants to talk to us all the time!
sentences.chinese: 而且他依依哇哇的跟我們說個不停。
那嬰兒哇哇地哭了一夜。

sentences.english: Who has moved my bed ?" hollers Daddy bear in a very loud voice."
sentences.chinese: 誰動過我的牀？熊爸爸用很響的聲音哇哇大叫。

sentences.english: You don't want her fist time to end nine months from now with a crying baby.
sentences.chinese: 你不會想讓她第一次以一個哇哇大叫的寶貝結尾。

sentences.english: I think the cars were the cause of the crows' cawing.
sentences.chinese: 我想車是導致烏鴉哇哇的原因。

sentences.english: The baby emitted forth a cry.
Who has esten up my porridge?" hollers Daddy bear in a very loud voice."
sentences.chinese: 誰吃了我的粥？熊爸爸用很響的聲音哇哇大叫。

sentences.english: In that case, we would have to levy more taxes and reduce subsidies for everybody, which would give rise to complaint everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 那時就只有加稅和減少人頭費，就要弄得大家哇哇叫。

sentences.english: The crow has been crying outside of the window since morning. How annoying it is.
sentences.chinese: 老鴉從早上就在窗外哇哇的叫，真煩人。

sentences.english: The room abounded with screaming children.
sentences.chinese: 房間裏坐滿了哇哇亂叫的孩子。

sentences.english: The crying baby then could by no means call up his conscience.
sentences.chinese: 哇哇啼哭的嬰兒也無法喚醒他的良知。

sentences.english: At this moment, the child was frightened, crying loudly and shouting in confusion.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，小孩害怕了，嚇得“哇哇”地亂哭亂叫。

definition: (interj) boo hoo
hey/ow/ouch/interjection of pain or surprise
to inconsiderately shout
(onom.) for humming or whimpering
interjection of surprise/Oh my!
howl/bawl
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
to cry out/to bark out a sound
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
loud clamor/the sound of wailing
(onom.) sound of frogs, ducks etc
to cry out loud without tears
to cry out/to shout
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
exclamation/outcry/shout/yell
